content.description:
O vincit Amor omnia!
Felix amor miseriamiseria, -ae, f.: misery.
Aa, interj.: ah! Dulci morbomorbus, -i, m.: illness langueolangueo, -ere: to be weak,Â 
quo sic beate pereo.
content.question: In the passage, the poet reveals that

choices.label: love causes both pleasure and pain
love is wasting away inside of him

content.answer: love causes both pleasure and pain

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
